results.title: Astronomy: an Open Learning unit
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, Monash University, Open University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: This astronomy series features the southern skies particularly the work being done in Australia by scientists and astronomers who are trying to unravel the secrets of the universe. These programs are part of an Open Learning unit and can be viewed in conjunction with the series entitled “Universe: the infinite frontier.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Hollander, Monash University, Open University and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: A Watch on the southern sky
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Astronomy: an Open Learning unit”.
Provides a brief history of astronomy and a look at constellations. The program then focuses on how to map the sky and determine the location of celestial objects as well as looking at the differences between stars in terms of magnitude, colour and position. Examines the Moon and its cycles, and the location of planets in the night sky.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University

results.title: Bali: island of temples
results.creator_credit: Deben Bhattacharya, John Seabourne and Bay Street Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Shows how the every day lives of the Balinese is affected by the geography of the island and the Hindu attitude to the land.

group_siblings.title: Thailand: a land of smiles

results.title: Thailand: a land of smiles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”
Presents traditional aspects of the culture of Thailand. Discusses the geography, emphasising the importance of water for travel and agriculture. Shows dances, festivals, handicrafts, and the influence of religion on Thailand’s culture.

results.title: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Seabourne Enterprises and Bay Street Pictures Inc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Presents traditional aspects of Taiwanese culture. Contrasts the simple life, costumes, and art and crafts of the original natives of Taiwan with the culture of the Chinese. Focuses on the traditions of China as they are retained in Taiwan, including the cultivation of the arts, music, and calligraphy.

results.title: Hong Kong, Singapore: fragrant harbour, lion city
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, Queensland University of Technology, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the cultural background of Hong Kong and Singapore. Both places are governed by the professional elite ruling class. However, they have produced very different societies under the pressure of history and circumstances. Sujitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Japan
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
Shows how the various religious beliefs of the Japanese influenced their history. Commentary by John Temple and photography by Dean Semler.
